column4: Hey guys, can someone explain to me how to boot from a disc with the GRUB menu installed? I've tried removing my HDD from the boot list and it still boots to the GRUB menu. I'm running Ubuntu 12.04 as a secondary and I'm trying to upgrade my windows to windows 7 and I can't get it to boot to the install disc.
the grub menu might be installed on a different disk, so change your boot order
It has Ubuntu 12.04 and Windows XP.
Correct. Even with turning off my HDD from the boot order altogether.
